description.narrative:
Global Standard for CSO Accountability (2015-2018):
"The intervention's ultimate aim is to strengthen civil society organisations' effectiveness, by developing globally aligned, strong accountability practise".
Dynamic Accountability for a Resilient Civil Society (2018-2019):
"The aim of this extension phase is to strengthen civil society organisations' effectiveness and their resilience in repressive environments by building on the assets and the collective momentum created in the first phase of the Global Standard for CSO Accountability project as well as that of the Securing Civic Rights project. This approach will contribute to a more enabling environment for CSOs".
Resilient Civil Society in Times of Scrunity (2019-2020):
"The objective of the 2019-2020 extension phase is to strengthen civil society organisation's accountability, resilience and solidarity in times of scrunity. We ultimately aspire to strengthen the capacity of, and enable environments for CSOs to build a vibrant and pluralistic civil society worldwide".

Insatsen syftar till att stärka effektiviteten hos organisationer inom det civila samhället, genom att ta fram en "global standard for CSO accountability", ung. "riktlinjer för ansvarighet för organisationer i det civila samhället". Det globala civilsamhället enades 2011 om de så kallade Istanbul principerna för biståndseffektivitet, vilka utgör en bakgrund till insatsen. Insatsen syftar till att bidra till att implementera delar av principerna genom att utveckla gemensamma, globala metoder och verktyg för ansvarighet (accountability).
Insatsens övergripande syfte är att stärka effektiviteten hos det civila samhällets organisationer, genom att utveckla global praxis och riktlinjer för ansvarighet.
Projektets mål: 1) Förbättra CSOs ansvarighetskoder och hur dessa tillämpas 2) Minska transaktionskostnader 3) Bidra till en mer gynnsam miljö för det civila samhällets organisationer
Insatsen kommer att genomföras av the International Civil Society Centre (ICSC) vilka i sin tur samarbetar med nio olika projekt partners, vilka är större CSOs med tematisk erfarenhet och expertis, från sex olika kontinenter. Insatsen kommer att genomföras i tre faser: Den inledande fasen fokuserar på att samla existerande riktlinjer, definiera överlappningar och definitioner. Den andra fasen fokuserar på att gemensamt ta fram riktlinjer som är relevanta för alla deltagande partner. Den avslutande fasen utgör implementering av riktlinjerna hos de de deltagande organisationerna.
Samordning och dialog med externa aktörer och andra pågående processer inom det civila samhället är viktigt för att uppnå hållbara resultat. Kontakter och samarbeten är etablerade och the ICSC bedöms ha goda kontakter och erfarenheter för att använda dessa nätverk under insatsens genomförande.

International Civil Society Centre och INGO Accoutability Charter will implement the project Global Standard for CSO Accountability together with partner organisations in nine regions. The project's aim is to implement the Istanbul-principles and to work more effective within the civil society.

description.narrative:
Exempel på uppnådda resultat 2015-2020:
- "By March 2018, most of the Project Partners had adjusted their existing accountability frameworks in line with the Global Standard, developed new tools, or had concrete plans to do so by the end of 2018. Furthermore, many of them have used the Global Standard to improve their internal policies and guidelines, incorporating its content into their organisational identities".
- "Accountable Now (formerly the INGO Accountability Charter) went the furthest and fastest of all by in 2017 facilitating its members adoption of all 12 Global Standard Commitments with their exact wording, completely replacing its ten previous accountability statements. It also adjusted its reporting framework and guidance questions to reflect the 12 new Commitments".
- "The Global Standard prominently places one specific Commitment on environmental sustainability and one on gender equality in its first Cluster. Several Project Partners have reported important improvements to their codes, policies and practices in these two areas as a result. As the most obvious gaps many identified in their tools and frameworks, in several cases these were the first two benchmarks which Project Partners set with their members".
- "Through this project, we enabled three national campaigns that addressed the threats to civic freedoms. Campaigns were undertaken in Congo Brazzaville, Pakistan and Kenya. The campaign in Congo was by far the most successful and coherently planned despite significant obstacles they had to overcome. In 2017, a member of the Civic Charter community had initiated the Civic Charter Coalition for the Congo and used this coalition to build a strong base for advocacy with the government. Through this campaign, the coalition built significant support in several local communities. Through the campaigning at local level the coalition raised their profile and has now been invited by the government to engage in a dialogue on civil society rights with them. The campaign in Congo raised numbers of Civic Charter signatories, both organisational and individual".
- "Civic Charter Community members have consistently engaged in solidarity action throughout the project period. Several actions were directed at the developments in Hong Kong throughout April and May; other actions were directed at Singapore, Thailand as well as a joint push at the Press Freedom Day globally. In addition, participants of the Civic Charter Community Workshop from Uganda and Macedonia initiated during that workshop a bilateral cooperation between them to bring LGBT activists from Uganda to Macedonia for campaigning and messaging capacity building with Macedonia human rights and LGBT activists".
